column4: hey, I had a working xorg config, and then when I rebooted into windows and rebooted back, it now fails
and I tried to restore a working config with nvidia-xconfig, but that didn't work
yeah, I guess, I can't seem to get X to start now
all the logs say "No Screens found"
me as well
I am using the nvidia drivers (nvidia.com)
what do I do?
my xconfig was fine, and I rebooted, and now it no longer has a screen
or it doesn't think my screen section is valid
new kernel?
maybe, do I need to reinstall the driver?
I did run system update
k
wait, I like my xorg file
I don't want to totaly get rid of it
yes, unless you are using the packaged ubuntu drivers ( nvidia-glx)
k
I will re-install drivers
make a backup of the last known good xorg.conf
does anyone reccomend the beta drivers over the standard ones?
I sure will
